name: biblically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that comes from or relates to the Christian Bible: She insists that this kind of discrimination is biblically unjustified. They gave her the name Mary, which has so many connotations historically and biblically.
in a way that is like a story from the Bible, especially because of being very exciting, shocking, or extreme: Biblically, as soon as he finished speaking the heavens opened and torrential rain began to fall.
More examplesFewer examplesAnyone who claims to follow Jesus is Biblically bound by His example to love one another. He claims that biblically illiterate students cannot understand the many Christian references in Western literature.Biblically speaking, the word "conversion" means "turning around".We were struck by a number of minor catastrophes that were bad, but not biblically bad.
